study_identification.title: Accommodating Site Variation In Neuroimaging Data Using Normative And Hierarchical Bayesian Models

clarity_of_research_objectives.reason: The abstract clearly states the objective to accommodate multi-site effects by including site as random effects in hierarchical Bayesian models, compares linear vs. non-linear models, specifies datasets (ABIDE controls and autism) and evaluation against harmonization methods.
clarity_of_research_objectives.supporting_text: In this study, we suggest accommodating for these site effects by including them as random effects in a hierarchical Bayesian model. We compared the performance of a linear and a non-linear hierarchical Bayesian model... We used data of 570 healthy individuals from the ABIDE... and individuals with autism... We compared ... to ... ComBat...

clear_definition_of_target_population.reason: The paper specifies that ABIDE healthy controls and autism participants were used with counts and sex distribution, but diagnostic criteria (e.g., DSM/ICD) and control definitions are not explicitly detailed within this manuscript.
clear_definition_of_target_population.supporting_text: ... 539 individuals with autism spectrum disorder and 573 age-matched typical controls. For this study, we used 569 controls... 482 individuals with autism... 470 were male ... 430 were male.

clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.reason: Data-level outlier handling and missing-value handling are described (region-wise outliers removed; model-specific exclusions for ComBat GAM), but participant-level inclusion/exclusion criteria and flow are not fully specified.
clarity_of_inclusion_and_exclusion_crite.supporting_text:
Measures of cortical thickness were extracted ... scanned for outliers ... above or beyond 2 inter quartile ranges ... removal of 1055 out of 162905 data points ...
ComBat Gam ... does not [accept missing values] ... sample size reduction from 391 to 370 (train) and 168 to 156 (test).

validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.reason: Outcome measures are clearly defined: cortical thickness across 34 DK atlas regions; individual-level deviation quantified as z-scores; thresholds and prevalence (±1.96 ≈ 95%) are described; reference population characteristics are specified.
validity_of_normative_modeling_outcome_m.supporting_text:
... focused on cortical thickness measures of the 34 bilateral regions ...
Finally, each individual's z-score of deviation can be calculated ...
We define a z-score of ± 1.96 based on the training set as atypical value ...

handling_of_confounding_variables.reason: Site is explicitly modeled via hierarchical random effects; age and sex are included as covariates; harmonization comparisons (ComBat with/without preserving age/sex) are discussed; multi-site characteristics are described.
handling_of_confounding_variables.supporting_text:
... data collected at 17 different scanning locations ... 3 Tesla scanners ... sequence parameters ... varied ...
... hierarchical Bayesian models that include site as a predictor ...
... ComBat ... and ... ComBat ... explicitly preserving the variance associated with sex and age ...
... predicting cortical thickness based on age, sex and site.

clarity_of_data_sources.reason: The source is the publicly available ABIDE dataset with link; number of sites and acquisition context are provided.
clarity_of_data_sources.supporting_text:
The ABIDE consortium ... publicly available ... preprocessed section of the ABIDE initiative ...
... aggregating data from 20 independent samples collected at 17 different scanning locations ...

description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.reason: Scanner field strength (3T) and multi-site variability are described, but specific sequence parameters (TR, TE, resolution, vendor models) are not detailed here.
description_of_image_acquisition_protoco.supporting_text: Although all data has been collected with 3 Tesla scanners and preprocessed in a harmonized way ... sequence parameters ... and type of scanner varied across sites.

details_of_data_preprocessing.reason: Preprocessing used FreeSurfer standard pipeline (DK atlas) from ABIDE Preprocessed Connectomes Project; region-wise outlier detection and hemisphere averaging are described.
details_of_data_preprocessing.supporting_text:
... standardized protocol ... FreeSurfer standard pipeline (Desikan-Kiliany Atlas) ...
... measures were scanned for outliers ... above or beyond 2 inter quartile ranges ... values of right and left hemisphere ... were averaged ...

clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.reason: A within-site split with preserved age/sex/site distributions is described (70/30; n=389 train, n=166 test) using R packages; autism set used for downstream application; standardization based on training set parameters.
clarity_of_data_partitioning_methods.supporting_text: ... split ... into a training set (70% ... n=389) and a test set (30% ... n=166) using the R package caret and splitstackshape, while the distribution of age, sex and site was preserved ... ('withinsite-split') ... standardized region-wise based on ... training set.

details_of_normative_modeling_approach.reason: Two hierarchical Bayesian models are specified (linear with site random effects; GP variant for age). Implementation details and inference in Stan are described; comparison models (ComBat, residuals) are outlined.
details_of_normative_modeling_approach.supporting_text:
... two versions of a hierarchical Bayesian models that include site as a predictor ... HBLM ... HBGPM ...
We use Stan ... to estimate all free parameters ... performing Bayesian inference ...
... normative models were implemented in Stan ... analyzed in R using rstan ... NUTS ...

details_of_training_algorithm.reason: Training/inference uses MCMC via Stan with NUTS; runs of 4000 iterations with 2000 warmup; convergence diagnostics (R-hat, ESS) referenced.
details_of_training_algorithm.supporting_text:
each model run entailed a Monte-Carlo sampling process of 4000 iterations in Stan, of which 2000 were disregarded as warm up ...
... uses the No-U-Turn Sampler (NUTS) ...
Parameters indicating the goodness of the model simulation process in Stan ... can be found in the supplementary material.

model_performance_evaluation_metrics.reason: Performance metrics are clearly defined: Pearson correlation (ρ), SRMSE, point-wise log-likelihood (LL), explained variance (EV), and mean standardized log-loss (MSLL).
model_performance_evaluation_metrics.supporting_text: Model performance is assessed using ... Pearson's correlation coefficient ρ ... standardized root mean squared error (SRMSE) ... point-wise log-likelihood ... proportion of variance explained (EV) ... mean standardized log-loss (MSLL).

implementation_of_internal_validation.reason: Train/test split within sites with preserved distributions; evaluation reported on held-out test set from the same dataset.
implementation_of_internal_validation.supporting_text: training set (70% ... n=389) and a test set (30% ... n=166) ... preserved between sets ... within-site-split.

external_data_validation.reason: No validation on an independent external dataset is reported; all analyses use ABIDE (controls and autism subsets).
external_data_validation.supporting_text: ABIDE dataset used for controls and autism; models trained/tested within-site; application to autism from the same dataset.

description_of_dataset_characteristics.reason: Sample sizes, sex distributions, age distributions and site counts are provided; phenotypic age distributions are summarized in figures.
description_of_dataset_characteristics.supporting_text:
... 539 ASD and 573 controls ... used 569 controls ... 482 autism ... male counts provided ...
Figure 2. ... Controls: Age male M=17.5 (SD 8.3), female M=15.6 (SD 7.0), range 6.5-40; Autism ... male M=16.9 (SD 6.5), female M=15.1 (SD 5.8) ...
... aggregating data from 20 independent samples ... 17 different scanning locations ...

performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.reason: Point estimates and comparative statistics (means, SDs, p-values; ANOVA/Tukey tests) are reported, but confidence or credible intervals are not consistently provided for key metrics.
performance_metrics_and_statistical_unce.supporting_text: Both the HBLM and the HBGPM outperformed all other comparison models ... (p < 0.001 for all comparisons). ... detailed comparisons ... SRMSE, EV, LL ... in supplementary material.

consideration_for_reproducibility.reason: Software and versions are specified (Stan v2.25, R/rstan); data availability is public (ABIDE); code for models is publicly available on GitHub.
consideration_for_reproducibility.supporting_text:
We declare that all software, data and code used for this paper is publicly available ... ABIDE ... Stan ... R ... rstan ... The Stan code ... available at: https://github.com/likeajumprope/Bayesian_normative_models.
Stan ... version 2.25; RStan package version 2.21.2.

interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.reason: The manuscript explains NM deviation scores, expected prevalence of extreme z-scores, and discusses clinical significance using control vs. autism comparisons while addressing preserved variance after site correction.
interpretation_specific_to_normative_mod.supporting_text:
... allowing to calculate a z-score of deviation from the norm at the level of the individual.
We define a z-score of ± 1.96 ... average percentage ... 5.7% (controls) vs. 7.8% (autism) ...
... models ... retain clinically useful variation while removing site related variation.

additional_comments.additional_comments: Methods-focused NM study addressing multi-site confounding via hierarchical Bayesian models (linear and GP). Extensive comparisons to harmonization approaches (ComBat) show improved performance and better retention of clinically relevant variance. Published DOI line shows a preprint DOI; the final journal DOI is not explicitly listed in the provided text.
